Reviews.Title: Sweet little camera...
Reviews.Author: Sheree Young
Reviews.Content: After much review for the "perfect" size camera that takes quality pictures, has good battery life and has face detection and image stabilized zoom, this camera was the pick!  It was a gift and the recipient can't say enough positive things about the quality of this camera. The price is a slight disadvantage but with free shipping and no tax, the cost evens out.  The use of a "standard" SD card vs. a memory stick, etc., is a huge advantage also.

Reviews.Title: A Mighty Gem!!
Reviews.Author: David Perez
Reviews.Content: This little giant is a great pocket camera with loads of power features.* Effective Image Stabilization* Automatic Intelligence Modes* Loads of Scene Settings that really work* Great zoom combination (optical/digital)* Extra Sharp Images* 28mm wide angle view* Super Compact* File Organization* Crystal clear 3.2" ScreenI could go on and on with all of the great features.If you buy this camera and learn how to take advantage of the features,  you will not be disappointed.  I would highly recommend it to anyone looking for a small camera with great performance features.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and Features - small package!!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey L. Funderburk
Reviews.Content: This camera has proven to be far better than I could have ever hoped!!  I purchased this camera after my previous point-shoot style camera was damaged while sandbagging a levee in Iowa...The Panasonic Lumix DMC-FX55P was ordered as a hurried replacement before I left on a trip.  The camera has excellent lense quality and an outstanding array of features.  I really appreciated that the menus and functioning are pretty intuitive if you have experience using cameras.  I've mostly worked with Canon products previously and still like that gear very much.  Even though I had not used a Panasonic before, locating features was easy and intuitive.  I purchased this unit instead of the Canon because the Panasonic is a smaller, flatter camera that offers all of the same features that I wanted for much less money.Simply put, I have not used a small camera which produced such high quality photos and offered such great flexibility of use.  The flash is powerful and offers several settings.  I've used the camera in a variety of situations ranging from concerts, over dinner, by a campfire, macro photos of bugs, and in the dead of night.  All situations resulted in outstanding photos.  The battery life has been very good.  The wide angle is VERY useful. I just returned from 6 days of camping using the camera every day (not constantly) and never needed a charge.I simply can't think of anything else I would like in such a camera.  A great purchase that I could recommend to anyone.

Reviews.Title: the lumix fx55k
Reviews.Author: tetsudo
Reviews.Content: a nice little camera beautiful to look at and to hold. the 28mm-100mm range and 3" lcd sold me despite the warning of the high cost of the battery. i don't know if the image quality is any better than comparable competitors. wish it came with an extra battery and sd card. these hidden costs bring the price up from the initial eye-catching allure but all in all i am happy enough.

Reviews.Title: Great snapshot camera
Reviews.Author: Keith A. Mesch "MeTinMan"
Reviews.Content: Excellent small, convenient snapshot camera. All of the controls are really easy to use and in the right positions. The picture quality is outstanding and there is plenty of control over the size of the files. The only drawback that I found is that it does not have a fully manual setting for the exposure and the longest exposure setting appears to be about 1 sec. I am sure that I won't need these settings too often. Overall an excellent purchase. I would recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Very happy
Reviews.Author: Juan Antonio Garcia
Reviews.Content: I had this camera for a month now and I am very happy. The quality of the camera is very good. Feels solid and the screen quality is also good not to mention huge 3.2". Also the inter phase is very simple and straight forward. It is  a little heavier and thicker than other point and shoot cameras but its worth it. I am buying one for my parents as a present as well.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: D. Schmitz "Moretoysthancash"
Reviews.Content: Great camera!  The 28mm equivalent wide angle lens allows shots many compacts can't handle nearly as well.  The 3" LCD is a great feature and can be made brighter for intense sunlight or off-angle viewing with the touch of a button.  The face recognition and image stabilization work very well.  I was also quite impressed with the video capability. Tons and tons of features!  Did extensive research and the 55 could not be beat for the price.  Substantially less than the comparable Canon 870is.  Shorter and thinner too!  Recommended.

Reviews.Title: Power packed dynamo camera!
Reviews.Author: Fuzzy
Reviews.Content: This is a small power packed camera that really delivers...I'll keep it short but this camera is the best Point & Shoot camera I have ever owned.  I have owned several brand of P&S; camera's Nikon, Canon, Kodak etc, and none have come close to the picture quality of this dynamo! Many of the other camera's I have owned were in the $300+ range and for the price of this camera you are getting a tremendous deal.  The Leica lens really delivers, the camera options are very intuituve & easy to navigate. The small compact size is perfect for those get-a-ways when you don't want to pack your DSLR & many shots I have taken rival shots from my Nikon DLSR. One recommendation is to buy the Lumix leather carry case, although the camera is small, it does have a boxy design and a smidge thicker than other camera's in its category & it may not fit most cases. This is to protect the supurb 3 inch LCD screen from scratches. Other than that I highly recommend the purchase of this camera. I'm even going to buy one for my Mother I'm so impressed with it!

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera, Great Display and Features
Reviews.Author: Rob NY "NY-Bob"
Reviews.Content: This is a excellent camera, My first surprise was how bright the display is, can been seen and read outdoors. Takes great macro shots.One issue I had was outside exposure was a bit high in bright sunlight, I adjusted it for one stop under, and now the shots have rich deep color. The camera is fast and responsive. The wide angle is perfect. Would have liked a more substantial grip, but that would have made the camera larger. Can take wide-screen video in 18 minute increments of 2gb. I take it everywhere, recommended.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: A. Martin
Reviews.Content: I waited a long time for a camera to come out with this feature set.  I really got it for the wide angle still photos.  However, I have been very impressed with the wide screen video and sound recording.  The camera has exceeded my expectations.

Reviews.Title: What a camera!
Reviews.Author: Jenn T "Jenn Tidwell"
Reviews.Content: I had lost this same camera and was thrilled to replace it, there's not another one like it!

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: TO "OB"
Reviews.Content: just a great all around camera. I dont know why anyone would buy anything other than a panasonic. Leica lens, huge lcd screen, its fantastic.

Reviews.Title: excellent
Reviews.Author: Chi Fai Poon "samuel"
Reviews.Content: it's a excellent camera. it's easy to use and many function. but it's not easy to buy a replacement battery.

Reviews.Title: Great durable little camera
Reviews.Author: J. Wang
Reviews.Content: This is my third camera, and I've owned it within the first week of its initial release. I was excited about the lenses, as well as the 'new' features that the line of cameras brought with them.First off, let's talk about the construction quality. The outer black is semi-scratch resistant, and has not worn away significantly within the last few years. The corners that are burnished metal have worn a little, but it is minor at best. The shiny parts in the front of the camera have gained noticeable scratches, since the detail put into them is very intricate, and fragile as a result. The screen has one small scratch that I inflicted by accident when fitting a custom screen protector onto it (how ironic, no?) Since then, the screen has not received any damage, but I do need to replace the protector fairly soon, as it's taken a heavy beating.My girlfriend knocked this camera off my table by accident one night, a fall that was approximately three feet onto wood. The camera integrity held, but for a few days the turning dial was giving me issues. This resolved itself somehow, and the camera still works fine.The camera's video capabilities are fantastic. You can film as long as you have memory and battery to spare, and I've ended up taking videos upwards of twenty minutes using this. The videos can be several different quality settings, but I recommend buying a larger capacity card and filming at the highest for the best results.Photos are nice and crisp, with best results during the day outside. Macro photos (close up) are nice too, but it's sometimes hard to get that perfect shot of something up close. Inside photos are good, but in comparison to canon cameras, I haven't been able to get those super crisp photos. The ISO setting I probably have wrong, but in darker photos there's a lot of noise. So just use flash...My favorite photo setting to use is the intelligent Auto, which automatically selects whatever setting would produce the best photo, detects people's faces, and then determines if the flash needs to be used (you can also force it on or off if you like)Battery life is fantastic! One charge can last me hours, or at least an entire day of touring. Just charge it once at night to make sure you'll still get through the rest of the day. On casual use, I only charge the camera at most once every two weeks and the battery is fine.I continue to look at the new cameras, but have not seen anything I would prefer over my lumix yet.

Reviews.Title: SAN DIEGO, CA
Reviews.Author: P. SANDERSON
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because my old one was too bulky.  I started a new job that requires me to take before and after photos quickly and easily..this one is a charm!  I love it.  Great quality photos, easy to use, nice and compact. And the distributor was great too, got it when promised, in perfect condition.  A winner all around!

Reviews.Title: AWESEOME!
Reviews.Author: L. Ormsbee
Reviews.Content: The camera was everything I thought it would be.  It is packed with features.  I really like the image stabilization.  Panasonic is the best when it comes to this feature.  The camera is compact, shoots a powerful 8.1M and my wife absolutely loves the light pink color.  What makes this even more AWESOME is the price!!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!
Reviews.Author: K. Xiao "Woofdoggies.com"
Reviews.Content: Great product for pro and beginner. Love the big screen, nothing needs to be cut off. Very sharp image on the computer. I give it a 10++++++

Reviews.Title: Good for a point and shoot
Reviews.Author: DME
Reviews.Content: this little camera has been with me in most of my travels. I usually keep it in the intelligent auto mode which is nice because I can just quickly whip it out and take a burst of pictures. Good color fidelity and better Iso adjustment than most cameras. It is a little slow on response time compared to a dslr but its pretty good when compared to other point and shoot cameras. Its the best point and shoot I have owned.

Reviews.Title: excellent little camera
Reviews.Author: Don J. Brand
Reviews.Content: The camera is absurdly easy to use and the pictures are clear, sharp and bright.  There is a tendency to mild overexposure (too light in bright scenes) which can be compensated for by setting the exposure to -2/3.

Reviews.Title: Great little camera~
Reviews.Author: Pat_in_Tex
Reviews.Content: And very good quality pictures. These are as good a quality if not better than my old Pentax 35mm camera. And I got a great price because this camera was a design from 2007 and they had come out with newer models.edited to add: I've had this about 1.5 years and I've never been able to get the playback feature to work despite following the instructions to a T. Instead I get a message telling me there are no viable photos to play. I wanted to be able to edit the memory card so that I could keep using it when it was full. I'm able to copy the pics to my computer but it copies all of them every time I want to copy new ones and I have to go to extra steps to avoid the redundancy. Had I known about this problem I probably would have bought a different Lumix.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Camera
Reviews.Author: Mudit
Reviews.Content: Its a good product and I think is a value for money after the discount at Amazon.I suggest that with average family needs it could be bought

Reviews.Title: great camera!
Reviews.Author: connorjack
Reviews.Content: In the past year, I have lost 3 cameras, so I was price shopping (in case I lose another one) hoping to spend less than I did for the other 3 cameras.  I found this on line for a very reasonable price, with features that made the camera "idiot proof".  I love the camera!  My daughters asked me where I got it, etc. and I'm sure they will be placing orders for their own.  It is very easy to use and the options available when taking pics are awesome.  I plan on keeping this one and will always keep my eye on it-I don't want to lose this one!The only drawback is the camera is not equipped with a memory card-I had to purchase one.

Reviews.Title: Panasonic Lumix DMCFX55K
Reviews.Author: J. Zielinski
Reviews.Content: Panasonic manufactures excellent cameras. This is one that fucntions flawlessly, produces high quality, vivid photographs at an affordable price. Lightweight, compact and an excellent battery life before recharging is needed. Attractive, sturdy yet modern design. May take pictures in quick succession with little lag time. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Totally pleased with the speed of delivery.
Reviews.Author: E. L. Mein "Lani"
Reviews.Content: Totally pleased with the speedy delivery of my Panasonic Lumix Camera.  A camera freak friend of mine recommended the camera.  Too many features to discuss. I love this powerful little pink wonder..the same people found me a pink camera case.  I'm a 73 yr old former camera pro, going through my 'pink' period.

Reviews.Title: Didnt love
Reviews.Author: baseballmom96
Reviews.Content: We ended up returning this ...was suppose to be a simple camera for my 14 year old..though it had some cool effects..like black and white setting...was already out of date and seemed like a $50 camera alot of steps just to delete one picture and if you want to delete a batch it takes like 5 min.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: Jazzyjava "Janet"
Reviews.Content: This is my first digital camera, so I am still getting used to it.  It has lots of features, if you want to do manual adjusting.

Reviews.Title: Unhappy
Reviews.Author: ed
Reviews.Content: After reading all of the reviews about this point and shoot camera I was foolish enough to go with my impulses and purchase one. I can only speak for myself when I say it was not what I expected. I guess the wide angle lens is ok if you have a use for that. I personally found the zoom to be very slow and awkward. The camera is boxy and difficult to slide into a small camera case because of the shape. The LCD screen is large and unprotected making it very easy to scratch. Not that easy to view in bright sunlight, and no view finder. Picture quality is good, but I don't think it is as good as a comparable canon model. I am returning this camera even with being charged a $31 restock fee + shipping. Unfortunately this camera was not available in any store to test features, if it would have been I would have never brought it home. Sometimes advertising can be misleading. I will be exchanging it for a canon point and shoot as I am comfortable with Canon functions, and it will better fit my needs.

ProductInfo.Features:
8.1-megapixel CCD captures enough detail for photo-quality 16 x 22-inch prints
3.6x wide-angle image-stabilized optical zoom; 3-inch LCD display
Intelligent Auto Mode with Face Detection and Intelligent Scene Selector
High-Sensitivity mode shoots at an ISO equivalent of 6400; Continuous Autofocus, which minimizing autofocus time
Stores images on SD memory cards (includes 27MB of internal memory; powered by lithium-ion battery (battery and charger included)
ProductInfo.Name: Panasonic Lumix DMC-FX55S 8.1MP Digital Camera with 3.6x Wide Angle MEGA Optical Image Stabilized Zoom (Silver)
